DOC.brief_summary: A prospective randomized study comparing a new implant with three interlocked pins for internal fixation of femoral neck fractures (Hansson Pinloc System, Swemac Linköping, Sweden) versus 2 parallel pins with hooks (Hansson Pins, Swemac Linköping, Sweden).
DOC.brief_title: Pinloc Versus Hansson Pins in the Treatment of Femoral Neck Fractures.
DOC.detailed_description: Patients, who are to be treated with internal fixation due to a femoral neck fracture, will be randomized by the surgeon to Pinloc or Hansson Pins using an on-line randomization system. The patients will be followed up at open visits at 3 months and 1 year. At two years the patients will be contacted by phone and medical records studied in order to detect any fracture complications.
DOC.criteria: Femoral neck fractures where the preferred treatment is internal fixation. Unwilling to participate.
